alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Strafford; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 16 at 11:54PM EDT until July 17 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Showers could continue to produce very heavy rainfall in a very short time span into tonight. Highest threat areas are those that have been recently affected by heavy rain and flooding as well as highly sloped, fast-responding small streams in the mountains. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following areas, Androscoggin, Central Interior Cumberland, Central Somerset, Coastal Cumberland, Coastal Waldo, Coastal York, Interior Cumberland Highlands, Interior Waldo, Interior York, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Northern Franklin, Northern Oxford, Sagadahoc, Southern Franklin, Southern Oxford and Southern Somerset. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Belknap, Cheshire, Coastal Rockingham, Eastern Hillsborough, Interior Rockingham, Merrimack, Northern Carroll, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Carroll, Southern Coos, Southern Grafton, Strafford, Sullivan and Western And Central Hillsborough. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding can involve major disruptions to travel, damages to property, and displacement of people. The risk is high for campers near fast responding streams which could become dangerous rivers with flood waters spreading well away from the banks. Inundation of roads are likely with additional washouts and some long term closures possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Multiple rounds of torrential rainfall are possible. Saturated soils from recent rainfall will support rapid runoff and lead to flash flooding. Considerable impacts are possible where storms repeat.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. If you are in a flood prone area, prepare for rapid onset flooding, with minimum time to react. Never camp on low ground next to streams since a flash flood can catch you while you`re asleep.
